name: Automated Template Selection Overview
title: Automated Template Selection Overview
body:
Note: We’ve added advanced features to phishing templates! All accounts will be opted in to phishing template advanced features in 2025. For more information, see our Phishing Templates Advanced Features Guide.

When creating a phishing campaign, you have the option to use one of our Automated Template Selections to automatically select the templates used in your campaign. Automated template selections choose templates from topics you select and add variety to recurring phishing campaigns.

The three automated template selection options are AI-selected (Diamond-level customers only), Full Random, and Random. Click on the tabs below to learn more about each option.

AI-selected Phishing Templates

Diamond-level customers have the option to use AI-selected phishing templates. This feature uses data from KnowBe4’s Artificial Intelligence Defense Agents (AIDA) to select the most relevant and challenging template for each user. AI-selected templates are chosen based on a user’s training history, phishing events, and performance metrics, such as their Phish-prone percentage and Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA) results. The more data AIDA has, the better it works, so we recommend using these templates for users who have some prior training or phishing history.

To avoid repetition in recurring campaigns, the AI-selected feature remembers the last five emails sent to each user and selects a different template for subsequent tests.

When using AI-selected templates, choose multiple topics to ensure you have a minimum of 20 templates. Providing a large number of templates for AIDA to choose from allows for more variety in your campaign. For best results, we recommend using 50 templates or more.

Full Random (Random Email to Each User)

The Full Random option automatically chooses different templates for each user by pulling from the selected topics. Users enrolled in the campaign will receive a variety of different emails. Using Full Random is a great way to prevent users from telling each other about an incoming phishing test. For an even more effective test, we recommend sending the emails over a period of time.

Note: To prevent users from getting the same phishing templates too often, the Full Random option skips the five most recently used phishing templates that were sent to each user.

Random (Same random email to all users)

The Random option will automatically choose one template from the selected topics. All users enrolled in this campaign will receive the same email. To help prevent users from telling each other about this phishing test, we recommend sending all emails when the campaign starts.

To avoid repetition in recurring campaigns, this feature remembers the last five emails sent and selects a different template for subsequent tests.

For more information about phishing campaigns, see our Creating and Managing Phishing Campaigns article.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen segment focused on template and difficulty selection.

### UI Element Description

1.  **Template Topics:** A multi-select input field currently displays two selected items (tags): **Business Communication** and **CEO Fraud**. Each selection includes a dismissal 'X' icon.
2.  **Template Language:** A checkbox option labeled **Set Template Language** is present, accompanied by a circular help icon (?).
3.  **Difficulty Rating:** A dropdown menu is set to **All Ratings**, also accompanied by a help icon.
4.  **Template Selection:** This is the primary focus. The associated dropdown menu is open, displaying several configuration options:
    *   The placeholder text in the main field is **Select a type of Template**.
    *   A grouping header, **AUTOMATIC TEMPLATE SELECTION** (grey, capitalized text), precedes the AI options.
    *   The option **AI-selected, powered by AIDA.** is currently highlighted in a blue background with an orange border, indicating selection or focus.
    *   Manual selection options follow:
        *   **Full Random (Random email to each user)** (Bold text indicates the primary option name).
        *   **Random (Same random email to all users)**.
        *   **Specific Template (Choose one template)**.
5.  **Subsequent Fields:** Partially visible labels include **Phish Link Domain** and **Landing Page**, each associated with a circular help icon, suggesting further configuration steps.

This image displays a section of a configuration panel for template selection, focusing on options related to randomization and automation.

**UI Elements and Configuration Context:**

1.  **Template Topics:** Displays a tag-based input field with two existing selections: **Business Communication** and **CEO Fraud**.
2.  **Difficulty Rating:** A standard dropdown menu is set to **All Ratings**.
3.  **Template Selection (Active Dropdown):** The primary focus is the active dropdown menu for **Template Selection**, currently showing the placeholder text **Select a type of Template**.

**Dropdown Menu Content (Template Selection):**

The menu options are structured into categories:

*   **Header:** **AUTOMATIC TEMPLATE SELECTION** (Grayed text).
*   **Option 1 (AI Automation):** **AI-selected, powered by AIDA.** (Bold text, indicating an automated method).
*   **Option 2 (Highlighted Selection):** **Full Random (Random email to each user)** (Highlighted in blue/orange, indicating the currently focused or selected option).
*   **Option 3 (Randomized Selection):** **Random (Same random email to all users)**
*   **Option 4 (Specific Selection):** **Specific Template (Choose one template)**

**Additional Contextual Labels:**

Below the active dropdown, the parameter labels **Phish Link Domain** and **Landing Page** are visible, each accompanied by a help icon (question mark inside a circle). Help icons are also present next to the **Set Template Language** checkbox and the **Difficulty Rating** field.
